text.section: The Secretary may designate an area as an arts and entertainment district only if the area is a contiguous geographic area that is wholly within a priority funding area as provided under § 5-7B-02 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

section.section: Within 60 days after a submission date, the Secretary may designate one or more arts and entertainment districts from among the areas in the applications timely submitted.
A county may not receive more than one arts and entertainment district designation in a calendar year.

text.section: The designation of the Secretary is final.
At any time, a political subdivision may reapply to the Secretary to designate as an arts and entertainment district an area that is not so designated.
